Race.SpecificTitle: PW Parish Council (Vet) -- Disabled Vet. Homestead Exemp. - PC
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Disabled Veterans Homestead Exemption)

Summary:  Authority to exempt from ad valorem taxation the next seven thousand five hundred dollars of the assessed valuation after the homestead exemption of property receiving the homestead exemption which is owned and occupied by a veteran with a service-connected disability rating of one hundred percent as determined by the United States Department of Veterans Affairs; and to make the surviving spouse of a veteran eligible for this exemption if this exemption was in effect on the property prior to death of the veteran.
Race.FullText: Shall Jefferson Parish exempt from ad valorem taxation the next seven thousand five hundred dollars of the assessed valuation after the homestead exemption of property receiving the homestead exemption which is owned and occupied by a veteran with a service-connected disability rating of one hundred percent as determined by the United States Department of Veterans Affairs; and shall the surviving spouse of a veteran be eligible for this exemption if this exemption was in effect on the property prior to death of the veteran, all in accordance with the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Constitution of Louisiana, said exemption to extend and apply in Jefferson Parish and become effective only after the question of its adoption has been approved by a majority of the registered voters of the Parish voting in an election held for that purpose?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Kenner Prop. #1 (Sewerage) -- 1.14 Mills - Mayor & CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Kenner Propositions
Proposition No. 1
(Millage Renewal)
(Sewerage Department)

Summary:  10-year 1.14-mill tax renewal for acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating the City's wastewater collection, treatment and disposal system, including salaries and benefits of sewerage department personnel.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Kenner, State of Louisiana, under the provisions of Article VI, Sections 30 and 32 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, continue to levy and collect a special tax of one and fourteen hundredths (1.14) mills on all the property subject to taxation within said City, for a period of ten (10) years beginning with the year 2012 and ending with the year 2021, inclusive, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating the City's wastewater collection, treatment and disposal system, including salaries and benefits of sewerage department personnel? (estimated annual revenues: $513,000.00)

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Kenner Prop. #2 (Garbage) -- 1.61 Mills - Mayor & CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Kenner Propositions
Proposition No. 2
(Millage Renewal)
(Garbage Collection and Disposal)

Summary:  10-year tax 1.61-mill tax renewal for acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating garbage collection and disposal facilities and/or services in and for the City, including salaries and benefits of garbage department personnel.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Kenner, State of Louisiana, under the provisions of Article VI, Sections 30 and 32 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, continue to levy and collect a special tax of one and sixty-one hundredths (1.61) mills, on all the property subject to taxation within said City, for a period of ten (10) years beginning with the year 2012 and ending with the year 2021, inclusive, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating garbage collection and disposal facilities and/or services in and for the City, including salaries and benefits of garbage department personnel? (estimated annual revenues: $725,000.00)

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Kenner Prop. #3 (Fire Dept) -- 7.40 Mills - Mayor & CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Kenner Propositions
Proposition No. 3
(Millage Renewal)
(Fire Department)

Summary:  10-year 7.40-mill tax renewal for acquiring, constructing, improving, equipping, maintaining and/or operating fire department buildings and facilities, for acquiring, maintaining and operating fire department vehicles and equipment, and for paying salaries and benefits of fire department personnel.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Kenner, State of Louisiana, under the provisions of Article VI, Sections 30 and 32 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, continue to levy and collect a special tax of seven and forty hundredths (7.40) mills on all the property subject to taxation within said City, for a period of ten (10) years beginning with the year 2012 and ending with the year 2021, inclusive, for the purpose of constructing, improving, equipping, maintaining and/or operating fire department buildings and facilities, for acquiring, maintaining and operating fire department vehicles and equipment, and for paying salaries and benefits of fire department personnel? (estimated annual revenues:  $3,330,000.00)
